tests.name: AWS Cloud  Final Test
tests.description: This test is designed to assess your knowledge of AWS Cloud concepts, services, pricing models, security practices, and best practices. It covers a range of topics including core AWS services, cloud computing benefits, AWS shared responsibility model, and more.

questions.question: Which of the following are NOT benefits of AWS Cloud computing? (Choose 2)
options: Multiple procurement cycles and High latency
questions.explanation: Multiple procurement cycles and high latency are NOT benefits of AWS cloud computing. AWS eliminates long procurement cycles and provides low-latency access through global infrastructure.

questions.question: True or False: Cloud computing provides a simple way to access servers, storage, databases, and application services over the internet, but you own the network-connected hardware.
questions.explanation: False. In cloud computing, AWS owns and maintains the hardware. Customers provision and use what they need without owning the underlying infrastructure.

questions.question: Which of these is NOT a benefit of cloud computing over on-premises computing?
options: Pay for racking, stacking, and powering servers
questions.explanation: Paying for racking, stacking, and powering servers is NOT a benefit - AWS handles these infrastructure tasks, eliminating the need for customers to manage them.

questions.question: Which of the following is a compute service?
questions.explanation: Amazon EC2 (Elastic Compute Cloud) is AWS's primary compute service that provides virtual servers in the cloud.

questions.question: Economies of scale result from _________.
options: Having hundreds of thousands of customers aggregated in the cloud
questions.explanation: AWS achieves economies of scale by aggregating hundreds of thousands of customers, which reduces costs that are passed back to customers through lower pricing.

questions.question: Which of these are ways to access AWS core services? (Choose 3)
options: AWS Management Console, AWS CLI, and SDKs
AWS Management Console, Email requests, and Phone support
SDKs, REST APIs, and Email interface
AWS CLI, Phone support, and Management Console
questions.explanation: AWS provides three main access methods: AWS Management Console (web interface), AWS Command Line Interface (CLI), and Software Development Kits (SDKs) for various programming languages.

questions.question: What are the advantages of cloud computing over computing on-premises?
options: Go global in minutes and Increase speed and agility
questions.explanation: All options listed are advantages of cloud computing: avoiding capital expenses, using on-demand capacity, global deployment in minutes, and increased speed and agility.

questions.question: What is the pricing model that enables AWS customers to pay for resources on an as-needed basis?
questions.explanation: Pay-as-you-go pricing allows customers to pay only for the resources they actually use, without long-term commitments or upfront fees.

questions.question: Which of these is NOT a cloud computing model?
questions.explanation: The three main cloud computing models are IaaS, PaaS, and SaaS. 'System administration as a service' is not a recognized cloud computing model.

questions.question: True or False: AWS owns and maintains the network-connected hardware required for application services, while you provision and use what you need.
questions.explanation: True. This is the fundamental concept of cloud computing - AWS manages the underlying infrastructure while customers consume services as needed.

questions.question: Where can a customer go to get more details about Amazon EC2 billing activity that took place 3 months ago?
questions.explanation: AWS Cost Explorer provides detailed historical cost and usage data, allowing customers to analyze spending patterns over time, including past months.

questions.question: True or False: To receive the discounted rate associated with Reserved Instances, you must make a full, upfront payment.
questions.explanation: False. AWS offers three Reserved Instance payment options: All Upfront (AURI), Partial Upfront (PURI), and No Upfront (NURI), providing flexibility in payment terms.

questions.question: What options are available for reserved instances? (Choose 3)
questions.explanation: The three Reserved Instance payment options are: AURI (All Upfront), NURI (No Upfront), and PURI (Partial Upfront), referring to how the reservation is paid for.

questions.question: Which statement is true about the pricing model on AWS?
options: Storage is typically charged per gigabyte
All services have fixed monthly pricing
Compute costs are the same across all regions
Data transfer inbound is always charged
questions.explanation: AWS storage services like S3 and EBS are typically charged based on the amount of gigabytes used, often with tiered pricing where cost per GB decreases with higher usage.

questions.question: What are the four support plans offered by AWS Support?
questions.explanation: AWS offers four support plans: Basic (free), Developer, Business, and Enterprise, each with increasing levels of support and features.

questions.question: What AWS tool lets you explore AWS services and create an estimate for the cost of your use cases on AWS?
questions.explanation: AWS Pricing Calculator allows you to model your solutions, explore price points, and create cost estimates for your AWS use cases before building them.

questions.question: As AWS grows, the cost of doing business is reduced and savings are passed back to the customer with lower pricing. What is this optimization called?
questions.explanation: Economies of scale occur when AWS's large customer base and infrastructure investments allow them to reduce costs, which are then passed to customers through lower prices.

questions.question: True or False: AWS offers a variety of services at no charge including Amazon VPC, IAM, Consolidated Billing, AWS Elastic Beanstalk, AWS Auto Scaling, AWS OpsWorks, and AWS CloudFormation.
questions.explanation: True. These AWS services are available at no additional charge, though you may be charged for other AWS services used in conjunction with them.

questions.question: What are the benefits of using AWS Organizations? (Choose 2)
options: Create groups of accounts with attached policies and Automate account creation with APIs
questions.explanation: AWS Organizations helps manage multiple AWS accounts by creating groups with policies and automating account management through APIs.

questions.question: True or False: Unlimited services are available with the AWS Free Tier to new AWS customers for 12 months.
questions.explanation: False. The AWS Free Tier applies only to certain services with specific usage limits, not unlimited access to all services.

questions.question: Amazon Simple Storage Service (Amazon S3) provide a good solution for which of the following use cases?
options: An internet accessible storage location for video files that an external website accesses
A relational database for transaction processing
questions.explanation: Amazon S3 is ideal for storing and serving static content like video files to external websites due to its durability, scalability, and web accessibility.

questions.question: A company is using Amazon S3 alone to host their website. Which types of content does Amazon S3 support for static web hosting? (Select THREE)
options: HTML files, image files, client-side scripts, video and sound files
Server-side scripts, database files, and executable programs
Dynamic PHP pages and Java applications
questions.explanation: S3 static web hosting supports HTML, images, client-side scripts (JavaScript), videos, and audio files - all static content that doesn't require server-side processing.

questions.question: Which scenarios represent a good use for Amazon S3? (Select TWO)
options: Backing up critical data and Storing computation and analytics data
Running web applications and Processing real-time transactions
Hosting databases and Managing user sessions
Caching frequently accessed data and Load balancing
questions.explanation: S3 is excellent for data backup and storing large datasets for computation/analytics due to its durability, scalability, and cost-effectiveness.

questions.question: A company wants to use an S3 bucket to store sensitive data. Which actions can they take to protect their data? (Select TWO)
options: Enabling server-side encryption and Using client-side encryption for data in transit
Disabling versioning and Making the bucket public
Using only HTTP and Disabling logging
Storing encryption keys in the bucket and Using weak passwords
questions.explanation: Server-side encryption protects data at rest, while client-side encryption protects data during transmission to/from S3.

questions.question: A company must create a common place to store shared files. Which requirements does Amazon S3 support? (Select TWO)
options: Recover deleted files and Maintain different versions of files
Real-time file locking and Automatic file compression
File system mounting and Direct OS integration
Automatic file conversion and Real-time collaboration
questions.explanation: S3 supports versioning to maintain file history and can recover deleted files (if versioning is enabled), making it suitable for shared file storage.

questions.question: A customer service team accesses case data daily for up to 30 days. Cases can be reopened and require immediate access for 1 year after they are closed. Which solution is most cost-efficient?
options: Store case data in S3 Intelligent-Tiering to automatically move data between tiers based on access frequency
Store all data in S3 Standard storage class
Use S3 Glacier for all data storage
Store data in EBS volumes and take daily snapshots
questions.explanation: S3 Intelligent-Tiering automatically moves data between frequent and infrequent access tiers based on usage patterns, optimizing costs for data with changing access patterns.

questions.question: Which Amazon S3 unaccelerated data transfers have an associated cost? (Select TWO)
options: Out to the internet and Out to other AWS Regions
In from the internet and In from other AWS Regions
Between S3 buckets in the same region
questions.explanation: AWS charges for data transfer OUT from S3 to the internet and between AWS Regions. Data transfer IN to S3 is typically free.

questions.question: A company is migrating 100 terabytes of data from on-premises to Amazon S3 using a single 155 Mbps internet connection. Which data transfer option is the fastest and most cost-effective?
questions.explanation: AWS Snowball is designed for petabyte-scale data transfer, bypassing internet bandwidth limitations and providing faster, more secure large-scale data migration.

questions.question: A video producer must regularly transfer several video files (100-700 MB) to Amazon S3 with unreliable internet causing upload failures. Which solution provides the fastest, most reliable transfer?
questions.explanation: S3 multipart uploads allow parallel upload of file parts, improving transfer reliability and speed, with the ability to resume failed uploads.

questions.question: Which qualities vary by AWS Region? (Select TWO)
options: Cost-effectiveness of workloads and Service/feature availability
questions.explanation: Pricing and service availability can vary by region due to local infrastructure costs and regional service rollouts, while security and compliance standards are consistent globally.

questions.question: In the shared responsibility model, AWS is responsible for providing what?
questions.explanation: AWS is responsible for 'security of the cloud' - protecting the infrastructure that runs AWS services. Customers are responsible for 'security in the cloud' - how they configure and use AWS services.

questions.question: In the shared responsibility model, which are examples of 'security in the cloud'? (Choose 2)
options: Security group configurations and Encryption of data at rest and in transit
Physical data center security and Network infrastructure
Hardware maintenance and Facility access control
Server operating systems and Hypervisor security
questions.explanation: Security group configurations and data encryption are customer responsibilities ('security in the cloud'), while AWS handles physical security and infrastructure ('security of the cloud').

questions.question: Which of the following is the responsibility of AWS under the AWS shared responsibility model?
questions.explanation: AWS is responsible for maintaining the physical hardware, facilities, network infrastructure, and hypervisor. Customers manage their data, applications, and configurations.

questions.question: When creating an IAM policy, what are the two types of access that can be granted to a user? (Choose two)
options: Programmatic Access and AWS Management Console Access
questions.explanation: IAM users can be granted programmatic access (for API/CLI/SDK) and/or AWS Management Console access (web interface) with appropriate permissions.

questions.question: True or false? AWS Organizations enables you to consolidate multiple AWS accounts so that you centrally manage them.
questions.explanation: True. AWS Organizations allows you to centrally manage billing, control access, compliance, and security across multiple AWS accounts.

questions.question: Which of the following are best practices to secure your account using IAM? (Choose two)
options: Manage access to AWS resources and Define fine-grained access rights
Use root user for daily tasks and Share access keys
Create one admin user for everyone and Use simple passwords
Disable MFA and Use access keys in source code
questions.explanation: Best IAM practices include managing resource access through policies and implementing fine-grained permissions following the principle of least privilege.

questions.question: Which of the following should be done by the AWS account root user?
questions.explanation: The root user should only be used for tasks that require root-level access, such as changing support plans, closing accounts, or modifying account settings.

questions.question: After initial login, what does AWS recommend as the best practice for the AWS account root user?
options: Delete the access keys of the AWS account root user
Use root user for all daily operations
Share root credentials with team members
Create access keys for automated scripts
questions.explanation: AWS recommends deleting root access keys and using IAM users for daily tasks to minimize security risks associated with root account compromise.

questions.question: How would a system administrator add an additional layer of login security to a user's AWS Management Console?
questions.explanation: Multi-factor authentication (MFA) adds an extra security layer by requiring users to provide a time-based one-time password in addition to their regular credentials.

questions.question: True or false? AWS Key Management Service (AWS KMS) enables you to assess, audit, and evaluate the configurations of your AWS resources.
questions.explanation: False. AWS KMS is for creating and managing encryption keys. AWS Config is the service that assesses, audits, and evaluates resource configurations.

questions.question: With Amazon VPC, what is the smallest size subnet you can have?
questions.explanation: The smallest subnet size in Amazon VPC is /28, which provides 16 IP addresses (11 usable for instances after AWS reserves 5).

questions.question: With Amazon VPC, what is the maximum size IP address range you can have?
questions.explanation: The largest CIDR block you can create for a VPC is /16, which provides 65,536 IP addresses (65,531 usable).

questions.question: You need to allow resources in a private subnet to access the internet. Which must be present?
questions.explanation: A NAT (Network Address Translation) gateway allows instances in private subnets to connect to the internet or other AWS services while preventing the internet from initiating connections with those instances.

questions.question: Which AWS networking service enables a company to create a virtual network within AWS?
questions.explanation: Amazon Virtual Private Cloud (VPC) lets you provision a logically isolated section of the AWS Cloud where you can launch AWS resources in a virtual network that you define.

questions.question: True or false? Private subnets have direct access to the internet.
questions.explanation: False. Private subnets do not have direct internet access. They require a NAT gateway or NAT instance to access the internet while remaining protected from inbound connections.

questions.question: Which component of AWS Global Infrastructure does Amazon CloudFront use to ensure low-latency delivery?
questions.explanation: CloudFront uses AWS Edge Locations - points of presence globally distributed - to cache content closer to users, reducing latency for content delivery.

questions.question: Which of the following is an optional security control that can be applied at the subnet layer of a VPC?
questions.explanation: Network ACLs are optional stateless firewalls that operate at the subnet level, controlling traffic in and out of subnets.

questions.question: What happens when you use Amazon VPC to create a new VPC?
options: A main route table is created by default
Internet Gateway is attached by default
questions.explanation: When creating a VPC, AWS automatically creates a main route table, but you need to manually create subnets, attach internet gateways, and configure routing.

questions.question: Which of the following can be used to protect Amazon EC2 instances hosted in AWS?
options: Both security group and network ACL
Neither security group nor network ACL
questions.explanation: Both security groups (instance-level stateful firewall) and network ACLs (subnet-level stateless firewall) can be used together to protect EC2 instances.

questions.question: You create a VPC with CIDR block 10.0.1.0/24. How many IP addresses are available?
questions.explanation: A /24 CIDR provides 256 total IP addresses. AWS reserves 5 IP addresses per subnet (network, broadcast, AWS services), leaving 251 available for instances.

questions.question: Why is AWS more economical than traditional data centers for applications with varying compute workloads?
options: Amazon EC2 instances can be launched on-demand when needed
All AWS services are free for the first year
questions.explanation: The on-demand nature of EC2 instances allows businesses to scale up during peak times and scale down during low usage, paying only for what they use rather than maintaining expensive idle capacity.

questions.question: If your project requires monthly reports that iterate through very large amounts of data, which EC2 purchasing option should you consider?
questions.explanation: Scheduled Reserved Instances are ideal for predictable periodic workloads that run on a regular schedule, like monthly reporting jobs.

questions.question: What is included in an Amazon Machine Image (AMI)?
questions.explanation: An AMI includes all the information required to launch an instance: template for root volume, launch permissions, block device mapping, and other configuration details.

questions.question: Which EC2 feature ensures your instances will not share a physical host with instances from any other AWS customer?
questions.explanation: Dedicated Instances run on hardware dedicated to a single AWS customer, providing isolation from other customers' instances for regulatory or security requirements.

questions.question: Which of the following services is a serverless compute service in AWS?
questions.explanation: AWS Lambda is a serverless compute service that runs code in response to events without requiring you to provision or manage servers.

questions.question: What is the service provided by AWS that enables developers to easily deploy and manage applications in the cloud?
questions.explanation: AWS Elastic Beanstalk is a Platform-as-a-Service (PaaS) that handles deployment, capacity provisioning, load balancing, and automatic scaling.

questions.question: Your web application needs four instances to support steady traffic. On the last day of the month, traffic triples. What is the most cost-effective way to handle this?
options: Run four Reserved Instances constantly, then add eight On-Demand Instances on the last day
Use only Spot Instances with auto-scaling
questions.explanation: Reserved Instances for baseline load with On-Demand for predictable spikes provides the best cost optimization for predictable variable workloads.

questions.question: True or false? Containers contain an entire operating system.
questions.explanation: False. Containers share the host operating system kernel and contain only the application and its dependencies, making them much lighter than virtual machines.

questions.question: Which Amazon EC2 option is best for long-term workload with predictable usage patterns?
questions.explanation: Reserved Instances provide significant cost savings (up to 75%) for predictable, steady-state workloads with 1- or 3-year commitments.

questions.question: Which must be specified when launching a new Amazon EC2 Windows instance? (Choose two)
options: Amazon EC2 instance type and Amazon Machine Image (AMI)
questions.explanation: Instance type (determines hardware capabilities) and AMI (contains the operating system and configuration) are required to launch any EC2 instance.

questions.question: True or false. Amazon S3 is an object storage suitable for the storage of flat files like Microsoft Word documents, photos, etc.
questions.explanation: True. Amazon S3 is object storage designed for storing and retrieving any amount of data from anywhere, perfect for documents, images, videos, and other unstructured data.

questions.question: Amazon S3 replicates all objects _________.
options: In multiple Availability Zones within the same region
Only in the primary Availability Zone
In a single data center for security
questions.explanation: By default, Amazon S3 Standard storage replicates data across a minimum of three Availability Zones within an AWS Region, providing 99.999999999% durability.

questions.question: Which of the following can be used as a storage class for an S3 object lifecycle policy?
options: Glacier, S3 Infrequent Access, and S3 Standard
Only S3 Standard and S3 Glacier
S3 Standard and Amazon EBS only
S3 Intelligent-Tiering and Amazon EFS only
questions.explanation: S3 Lifecycle policies can transition objects between S3 Standard, S3 Standard-IA, S3 One Zone-IA, S3 Intelligent-Tiering, and S3 Glacier storage classes.

questions.question: The name of an S3 bucket must be unique _________.
questions.explanation: S3 bucket names must be globally unique across all AWS accounts and regions because they're part of the DNS hostname used to access objects in the bucket.

questions.question: You can use Amazon Elastic File System (EFS) to:
options: Implement storage for EC2 instances that multiple virtual machines can access at the same time
Store database files for high-performance applications
questions.explanation: Amazon EFS provides scalable, shared file storage that can be accessed concurrently by multiple EC2 instances across multiple Availability Zones.

questions.question: Amazon Elastic Block Storage (EBS) is recommended when data _________ and _________.
options: Must be quickly accessible, requiring long-term persistence, and requires encryption
Is rarely accessed and can tolerate retrieval delays
Needs to be shared across multiple instances simultaneously
Is temporary and doesn't require persistence
questions.explanation: EBS is ideal for data that needs fast access, persistence beyond instance lifetime, and built-in encryption capabilities for sensitive data.

questions.question: True or false. By default all data stored in Amazon S3 is viewable by the public.
questions.explanation: False. By default, all S3 buckets and objects are private. Only the bucket owner has access unless explicitly granted through bucket policies or ACLs.

questions.question: Regarding Amazon S3 Glacier, what is a vault?
questions.explanation: In S3 Glacier, a vault is a container for storing archives (data objects). You can create multiple vaults to organize your archives.

questions.question: True or false. When you create a bucket in Amazon S3, it is associated with a specific AWS region.
questions.explanation: True. S3 buckets are created in a specific AWS region you choose, which determines the physical location where your data is stored.

questions.question: Which of the following are features of Amazon Elastic Block Store (EBS)? (Choose two)
options: EBS volumes can be encrypted transparently and Data is automatically replicated within an Availability Zone
EBS volumes can be shared across multiple instances simultaneously and Data is replicated across regions
EBS provides object storage and Charges are based on requests
EBS is serverless and Scales automatically
questions.explanation: EBS volumes support transparent encryption and automatically replicate data within the same Availability Zone for high availability, but are limited to single-instance attachment.

questions.question: You are designing an ecommerce web application that will scale to hundreds of thousands of concurrent users. What database technology is best suited to hold session state?
questions.explanation: Amazon DynamoDB is ideal for session state management because it provides single-digit millisecond latency at any scale and automatically scales to handle traffic spikes.

questions.question: Amazon RDS automatically patches the database software and backs up your database, storing the backups for a user-defined retention period.
questions.explanation: True. Amazon RDS automates routine database tasks including software patching, backups, and point-in-time recovery based on user-configured retention periods.

questions.question: You need to find an item in an Amazon DynamoDB table using an attribute other than the item's primary key.
questions.explanation: Scan operations examine every item in a table and return items that match filter conditions, but are less efficient than Query for large datasets.

questions.question: In Amazon DynamoDB, what does the Query operation enable you to do?
options: Query a table using the partition key and optional sort key filter
Efficiently retrieve items from a table or index
questions.explanation: DynamoDB Query operation allows you to efficiently retrieve multiple items with the same partition key, optionally filter by sort key, query secondary indexes, and is more efficient than Scan for targeted retrievals.

questions.question: Which AWS cloud service is best suited for analyzing your data by using standard SQL and existing business intelligence tools?
questions.explanation: Amazon Redshift is a data warehouse service optimized for analytical queries using standard SQL and integrates with popular BI tools like Tableau and QuickSight.

questions.question: In Amazon DynamoDB, an attribute is _________.
questions.explanation: In DynamoDB, an attribute is a fundamental data element, similar to a field or column in other database systems, that doesn't need to be predefined.

questions.question: If you are developing an application that requires a database with extremely fast performance, fast scalability, and flexibility in database schema, which service should you consider?
questions.explanation: DynamoDB provides single-digit millisecond performance, automatic scaling, and schema flexibility, making it ideal for high-performance applications with variable workloads.

questions.question: Which of the following use cases is appropriate for using Amazon RDS?
questions.explanation: Amazon RDS is ideal for online transaction processing (OLTP) workloads that require complex transactions, ACID compliance, and relational data modeling.

questions.question: What should you consider when choosing a database type?
options: Data size and data access patterns
Query frequency and high availability requirements
questions.explanation: Database selection should consider multiple factors including data characteristics, access patterns, performance requirements, scalability, availability, and consistency needs.

questions.question: A company has an application with .NET layer connecting to MySQL database. They want to move to AWS with high availability and automated backups. Which database is ideal?
questions.explanation: Amazon Aurora provides MySQL compatibility with better performance, automatic backups, high availability across multiple AZs, and automated failover.

questions.question: A developer is asked whether caching might improve performance of their online bidding application. How should they answer?
options: Using different types of caching at each application layer might improve both frontend and backend performance
Caching only helps with database performance
Caching is only useful for static content
Caching will not help real-time applications
questions.explanation: Strategic caching at multiple layers (CDN, application, database) can significantly improve performance for various types of applications, including real-time systems.

questions.question: An architect suggests implementing caching to address performance issues. What should developers consider when deciding where to add caching?
options: Consider the tolerance for stale data in each context where the data is used
Only cache data that never changes
Caching location doesn't matter as long as it's fast
questions.explanation: The key consideration for caching is data freshness requirements - some data can tolerate being stale while other data must be real-time.

questions.question: A developer needs an in-memory key-value store that supports read replicas and wants to keep it simple. Which option should they choose?
questions.explanation: ElastiCache for Redis supports read replicas, persistence, and advanced data structures, making it suitable for most caching scenarios requiring high availability.

questions.question: Amazon ElastiCache is added to improve response times and alleviate database pressure with RDS backend. What is the application developer's responsibility?
options: Writing code that looks for requested data in cache first, then requests from origin if not found
Configuring ElastiCache cluster settings and security groups
Managing ElastiCache node failures and backups
questions.explanation: Application developers must implement cache logic (cache-aside pattern) in their code to check cache first before querying the database.

questions.question: Which statement about Amazon ElastiCache is true?
options: Your application connects to an ElastiCache node using a unique endpoint address
ElastiCache automatically integrates with RDS without code changes
ElastiCache uses the same connection string as your database
questions.explanation: ElastiCache provides unique endpoint addresses that applications use to connect to cache nodes, requiring explicit integration in application code.

questions.question: Customers in London complain about performance of a web application hosted in New York. What might the developer implement?
options: Set up CloudFront distribution to serve static content from edge locations closer to UK users
Move the entire application to the London region
Increase instance sizes in New York
questions.explanation: CloudFront's global edge locations cache static content closer to end users, reducing latency for geographically distributed users without moving the entire application.

questions.question: A developer wants to increase cache hit ratio for their CloudFront distribution. What should they try?
options: Include only the minimum necessary values in the cache key
Increase the cache TTL to maximum
Cache all content regardless of size
questions.explanation: Optimizing cache keys by including only essential parameters increases cache hit rates by reducing unnecessary cache variations of the same content.

questions.question: Which statement about Amazon CloudFront cached file expiration is true?
options: After a file expires, the next request forwards to the origin server
Files never expire in CloudFront cache
Expired files are automatically deleted from origin
File expiration is managed by the client browser
questions.explanation: When a cached object expires (based on TTL), CloudFront forwards subsequent requests to the origin to fetch a fresh version and update the cache.

questions.question: Which use case suggests the use of Amazon CloudFront Functions?
options: A function that redirects to a different URL and adds a custom response header
Processing large video files for streaming
questions.explanation: CloudFront Functions are lightweight JavaScript functions that run at edge locations for simple tasks like URL rewrites, header manipulation, and request validation.

questions.question: Which statement reflects a benefit of lazy loading as a caching strategy?
options: Lazy loading avoids filling up the cache with data that is not requested
Lazy loading pre-warms the cache for better performance
Lazy loading ensures all data is always available in cache
Lazy loading reduces cache miss penalties
questions.explanation: Lazy loading only caches data when it's actually requested, preventing cache bloat with unused data and optimizing cache utilization.

questions.question: Which of the following AWS tools help your application scale up or down based on demand?
options: Amazon EC2 Auto Scaling and Elastic Load Balancing
questions.explanation: EC2 Auto Scaling automatically adjusts capacity based on demand, while Elastic Load Balancing distributes traffic across multiple targets, together enabling automatic scaling of applications.

questions.question: Which service would you use to send alerts based on Amazon CloudWatch alarms?
questions.explanation: Amazon SNS integrates with CloudWatch alarms to send notifications via email, SMS, or other protocols when alarms change state, enabling real-time alerting.

questions.question: Which of the following are characteristics of Amazon EC2 Auto Scaling? (Choose three)
options: Responds to changing conditions by adding/terminating instances, Launches instances from specified AMI, Enforces minimum number of running instances
Manages database connections, Optimizes network routing, Reduces storage costs
Provides DNS management, Offers SSL certificates, Manages domain registration
Encrypts data at rest, Controls access permissions, Monitors compliance
questions.explanation: Auto Scaling maintains desired capacity, scales based on policies, uses AMIs for instance launches, and ensures minimum/maximum instance counts are maintained.

questions.question: Which of the following must be configured on an Elastic Load Balancing load balancer to expect incoming traffic?
questions.explanation: Listeners check for connection requests on specific ports and protocols, defining how the load balancer receives and routes incoming traffic.

questions.question: Which elements are used to create an Amazon EC2 Auto Scaling launch configuration?
options: Amazon Machine Image, Instance Type, and EBS volumes
Load balancer, Target groups, and Health checks
CloudWatch alarms, SNS topics, and IAM roles
questions.explanation: Launch configurations specify the AMI, instance type, storage, and other parameters used when Auto Scaling launches new EC2 instances.

questions.question: Which service can help you collect important metrics from Amazon RDS and Amazon EC2 instances?
questions.explanation: Amazon CloudWatch collects and tracks metrics, collects and monitors log files, and sets alarms for AWS resources like EC2 and RDS.

questions.question: Which of the following are elements of an Auto Scaling group? (Choose three)
options: Maximum size, Desired capacity, and Minimum size
Launch configuration, Load balancer, and Scaling policies
Security groups, VPC, and Availability Zones
CloudWatch alarms, SNS topics, and IAM roles
questions.explanation: Auto Scaling groups define the minimum, desired, and maximum number of instances, controlling the scaling boundaries for the application.

questions.question: An auditor needs logs of all access to AWS resources in the account. Which service can assist?
questions.explanation: AWS CloudTrail records API calls and account activity, providing event history of actions taken through the AWS Management Console, SDKs, and CLI.

questions.question: In Elastic Load Balancing, when the load balancer detects an unhealthy target, which are true? (Choose three)
options: Stops routing traffic to that target, Resumes routing when target is healthy again, Routes traffic to healthy targets
Terminates the unhealthy instance, Creates a new instance, Updates the DNS records
Sends notifications to administrators, Creates CloudWatch events, Updates security groups
Changes the instance type, Modifies the AMI, Updates the launch configuration
questions.explanation: ELB automatically stops routing to unhealthy targets, continues monitoring their health, and resumes routing when they become healthy, while distributing traffic to healthy targets.

questions.question: What are the three types of load balancers that Elastic Load Balancing offers? (Choose three)
options: Application Load Balancer, Network Load Balancer, and Classic Load Balancer
Global Load Balancer, Regional Load Balancer, and Edge Load Balancer
HTTP Load Balancer, TCP Load Balancer, and UDP Load Balancer
Internal Load Balancer, External Load Balancer, and Cross-region Load Balancer
questions.explanation: ELB offers Application Load Balancer (Layer 7), Network Load Balancer (Layer 4), and Classic Load Balancer (previous generation) for different use cases.

questions.question: Before changing the instance type from t2.micro to t2.small, what must you do?
questions.explanation: You must stop an EC2 instance before changing its instance type. AWS doesn't allow instance type modifications while the instance is running.

questions.question: What is the primary function of an Amazon EBS Snapshot?
options: To create a point-in-time, incremental backup of the EBS volume
To increase the size of an EBS volume
To migrate an EBS volume to another region
To convert between EBS volume types
questions.explanation: EBS snapshots are incremental backups that only save the blocks that have changed since the last snapshot, stored in Amazon S3 for durability and cost-effectiveness.

questions.question: What are the specs of t2.micro instance?
questions.explanation: The t2.micro instance type provides 1 virtual CPU and 1 GiB of memory, making it suitable for low-traffic websites, development environments, and small applications.

questions.question: Which of the following is a compute service?
questions.explanation: Amazon EC2 (Elastic Compute Cloud) is AWS's primary compute service that provides virtual servers in the cloud.

questions.question: What are these? (Referring to Availability Zones in an AWS Region)
questions.explanation: Availability Zones are isolated locations within AWS regions that contain one or more data centers, providing high availability and fault tolerance.

questions.question: What is NOT true about Amazon S3?
options: You are billed only for what you use
questions.explanation: This IS true about S3. All options listed are actually true features of Amazon S3, so this question seems to have an error in the original document.

questions.question: What is this? (Referring to a NAT gateway in a VPC)
questions.explanation: A NAT gateway enables instances in private subnets to connect to the internet or other AWS services while preventing inbound connections from the internet.

questions.question: Your organization in Account A wants to allow developers in Account B to access an S3 bucket in Account A. What should you configure?
options: Use an IAM role in Account A with a trust policy for Account B
Create IAM users in Account A for each developer in Account B
Share the S3 bucket publicly with proper permissions
Use S3 cross-region replication to copy data to Account B
questions.explanation: IAM roles with cross-account trust policies allow users from one AWS account to assume roles in another account, providing secure cross-account access.

questions.question: Your team has 10 EC2 instances running in the same VPC. You need shared storage that all instances can read and write to at the same time. Which storage option fits best?
questions.explanation: Amazon EFS provides shared file storage that can be accessed concurrently by multiple EC2 instances across multiple Availability Zones.

questions.question: Your ALB has 4 targets in AZ-1 and 2 targets in AZ-2. Without cross-zone balancing, how is traffic routed?
options: Based on target health checks only
questions.explanation: Without cross-zone load balancing, the ALB distributes traffic evenly across all registered targets regardless of their Availability Zone.

questions.question: A media company needs significant computational power and hardware accelerators for rendering complex visual effects. Which EC2 instance type is BEST?
questions.explanation: Accelerated computing instances (P3, P4, G4) provide GPUs and other hardware accelerators ideal for graphics rendering, machine learning, and other compute-intensive workloads.

questions.question: Which component of AWS Global Infrastructure does Amazon CloudFront use to ensure low-latency delivery?
questions.explanation: CloudFront uses AWS Edge Locations - points of presence globally distributed - to cache content closer to users, reducing latency for content delivery.

questions.question: A student is learning about Amazon Simple Storage Service (Amazon S3). During an interview, a potential employer asks the student to explain how Amazon S3 can be used as a storage solution. Which option is a use case for Amazon S3?
questions.explanation: Amazon S3 is ideal for data lakes because it provides scalable, durable object storage that can handle massive amounts of unstructured data from various sources, making it perfect for analytics and big data workloads.

questions.question: A _________ organizes the Amazon Simple Storage Service (Amazon S3) namespace at the highest level.
questions.explanation: A bucket is the fundamental container in Amazon S3 that stores objects. Bucket names must be globally unique and form the top level of the S3 namespace hierarchy.

questions.question: A developer wants to store image files in a bucket that is called images-bucket, but receives the error BucketAlreadyExists. Which action must the developer take to resolve this error?
options: The developer must contact AWS Support to request approval to use the same bucket name
Bucket names are unique to the Region that they are created in. If the requested bucket name is not available, the developer must create the images-bucket in a different Region
Bucket names go to the highest bidder. The developer must outbid the current bucket owner
Bucket names are globally unique. If the requested bucket name is not available, the developer must rename the bucket
questions.explanation: S3 bucket names must be globally unique across all AWS accounts worldwide. If a bucket name is already taken, the developer must choose a different, unique name for their bucket.

questions.question: A developer is using Amazon Simple Storage Service (Amazon S3) to host a static website in a bucket that is called frank-martha-cafe. This bucket is in the us-east-1 Region. Which URL is the virtual-hosted-style URL for the website?
questions.explanation: The virtual-hosted-style URL for S3 static websites follows the format: https://bucket-name.s3-website-region.amazonaws.com. This provides a more user-friendly URL that includes the bucket name as a subdomain.

questions.question: After versioning is enabled on an Amazon Simple Storage Service (Amazon S3) bucket, it can be disabled.
questions.explanation: False. Once versioning is enabled on an S3 bucket, it cannot be disabled. However, you can suspend versioning, which stops creating new versions but preserves existing versions.

questions.question: What is the largest size of an object that a user can upload to Amazon Simple Storage Service (Amazon S3) in a single PUT operation?
questions.explanation: The maximum object size for a single PUT operation in S3 is 5 GB. For larger objects, you must use the multipart upload API to upload the object in parts.

questions.question: A developer uses an Amazon Simple Storage Service (Amazon S3) bucket. They want to allow a certain AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM) user to perform any S3 operations on the bucket and its objects. They also want to follow AWS recommendations for granting permissions. Which mechanism should the developer apply to the bucket?
questions.explanation: Bucket policies are the recommended way to manage bucket-level permissions in S3. They provide fine-grained control and can specify conditions, principals, and actions more comprehensively than other methods.

questions.question: A developer wants to allow a user to download private objects directly from an Amazon Simple Storage Service (Amazon S3) bucket without needing AWS security credentials or permissions. What can the developer share with the user to grant them time-limited access to the objects?
options: Their AWS account root user credentials
questions.explanation: Presigned URLs provide temporary, time-limited access to private S3 objects without requiring the user to have AWS credentials. The URL includes authentication information and expires after a specified period.

questions.question: Which method can be used to encrypt Amazon Simple Storage Service (Amazon S3) objects in transit?
options: Server-Side Encryption with Amazon S3-Managed Keys (SSE-S3)
Server-Side Encryption with AWS KMS-Managed Keys (SSE-KMS)
questions.explanation: SSL/TLS encryption protects data in transit between clients and S3. The other options (SSE-C, SSE-S3, SSE-KMS) are for encrypting data at rest, not in transit.

questions.question: A developer hosts a static website in an Amazon Simple Storage Service (Amazon S3) bucket. The website references image objects in another S3 bucket. However, these images do not display on the website. What could be the problem?
options: The bucket does not include an inbound rule
Cross-Region Replication (CRR) has not been enabled on the bucket where the assets are stored
Cross-Origin Resource Sharing (CORS) has not been enabled on the bucket where the assets are stored
Amazon S3 does not support object sharing between buckets
questions.explanation: When a web page served from one origin (S3 bucket) tries to access resources from another origin (different S3 bucket), CORS must be configured on the resource bucket to allow cross-origin requests.

questions.question: Which option is the Amazon Web Services (AWS) customer responsible for under the AWS shared responsibility model? (Select TWO)
options: Security group configuration and Client-side data
Physical servers and Edge location infrastructure
Availability Zone security and Physical servers
Edge location infrastructure and Security group configuration
questions.explanation: Under the shared responsibility model, customers are responsible for security IN the cloud (security groups, IAM, data encryption) while AWS is responsible for security OF the cloud (physical infrastructure, regions, availability zones).

questions.question: Which AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM) resource explicitly grants or denies permissions to a user or group of users?
questions.explanation: IAM policies are JSON documents that define permissions by specifying what actions are allowed or denied on which resources for which principals.

questions.question: What is the correct term for the process of verifying a user's identity as a developer?
questions.explanation: Authentication is the process of verifying identity (who you are), while authorization determines what you're allowed to do after you're authenticated.

questions.question: Which statements about IAM user authentication are true? (Select TWO)
options: AWS credentials and Console username/password are required
.pem files are used for console authentication
Root user should be used for programmatic access
questions.explanation: IAM users need AWS credentials (access keys) for programmatic access to AWS services and a username/password combination for console access. Using root user credentials for programmatic access is not a best practice.

questions.question: Which suggestion is an Amazon Web Services (AWS) recommendation for securing AWS credentials for applications that run on Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud (Amazon EC2) instances?
options: Embed AWS credentials in the software development kit (SDK) client code
Store credentials in local AWS configuration files
Create an AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM) role and attach it to the EC2 instance
Create an AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM) user and attach it to the EC2 instance
questions.explanation: IAM roles are the recommended way to grant permissions to EC2 instances. They provide temporary credentials that are automatically rotated and don't require storing long-term access keys.

questions.question: What is the format of AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM) policies that define the allowable API calls an entity can invoke?
questions.explanation: IAM policies are written in JSON format and consist of statements that define the effect (allow/deny), actions (API operations), resources, and optional conditions.

questions.question: An administrator created an AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM) group called managers within an AWS account. A policy is attached to the managers group. It allows managers to read from and write to an Amazon Simple Storage Service (Amazon S3) bucket in the same AWS account. What is this type of policy?
questions.explanation: Identity-based policies are attached to IAM identities (users, groups, roles) and define what actions those identities can perform on which resources.

questions.question: Which statement reflects best practices when granting permissions to users, groups, roles, and resources?
options: Create policies that allow broad access and then limit permissions as needed, based on usage
Use the account root user for routine tasks that the administrator performs
Create policies that follow the principle of least privilege
Do not set policies for individual resources
questions.explanation: The principle of least privilege means granting only the permissions required to perform a task. This minimizes security risks by limiting access to only what's necessary.

questions.question: What is the effect of a policy statement with 'Effect': 'Deny' and 'NotResource' element?
options: Denies actions on all resources except those listed in NotResource
Denies the ability to write to specific resources
Denies the ability to read from specific buckets
Denies actions only on the resources listed in NotResource
questions.explanation: The NotResource element in a deny statement means the policy denies the specified actions on all resources EXCEPT those listed in the NotResource element.

questions.question: Which statements are true about evaluation logic for AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM) policies? (Select TWO)
options: Explicit deny overrides explicit allow and Default deny
Explicit allow overrides explicit deny and Default allow
You cannot have deny and allow statements in the same policy
By default, all requests are allowed
questions.explanation: In IAM policy evaluation: an explicit deny always overrides any allows, and by default (if no policies apply), requests are denied. This is known as the 'default deny' principle.

questions.question: Which statement best describes Amazon DynamoDB?
options: An in-memory data store that can boost the performance of databases
A graph database engine that is optimized for storing billions of relationships
A relational database that is built for the cloud and is compatible with MySQL and PostgreSQL
A key-value and document database that scales horizontally and works well for internet-scale applications
questions.explanation: Amazon DynamoDB is a fully managed NoSQL database service that provides fast and predictable performance with seamless scalability, making it ideal for internet-scale applications.

questions.question: Which component is part of an Amazon DynamoDB table?
questions.explanation: In DynamoDB, attributes are the fundamental data elements that make up an item. Unlike relational databases, DynamoDB is schemaless except for the primary key attributes.

questions.question: An Amazon DynamoDB table called SensorReadings captures sensor readings. These readings include a sensor ID attribute that acts as the partition key, and a timestamp attribute that is the sort key. Which statement is true?
options: The sensor ID together with the timestamp represent a simple primary key
It is impossible for two items in the SensorReadings table to have the same partition key
It is impossible for two items in the SensorReadings table to have the same sort key
It is impossible for two items in the SensorReadings table to have the same primary key
questions.explanation: In a DynamoDB table with a composite primary key (partition key + sort key), the combination of both keys must be unique for each item, ensuring no two items have the same primary key.

questions.question: Suppose that a developer has a restaurants database table that can be queried by name (the partition key), or by name and location (the sort key). What should the developer do if they also want to query by type of cuisine and average customer rating?
options: Set up a local secondary index on cuisine and customer rating
Set up a global secondary index on cuisine and customer rating
Change the primary key on the restaurant table to be a complex primary key based on cuisine and customer rating
Perform a query that uses the cuisine and average customer rating attributes
questions.explanation: Global Secondary Indexes (GSIs) allow querying on attributes other than the primary key. They have their own partition and sort keys and can be created at any time without affecting the base table.

questions.question: A video game developer who uses Amazon DynamoDB wants to ensure that players' profiles are updated correctly when they make in-game purchases. This process requires multiple updates as part of a single user action. What is the best choice to write this developer's application to manage these complex, all-or-nothing changes?
options: Add an Amazon DynamoDB Accelerator (DAX) cluster
Create application code to check that all parts of the transaction were written successfully, and then roll back the update if any part failed
questions.explanation: DynamoDB transactions provide atomicity, consistency, isolation, and durability (ACID) across one or more tables, ensuring that either all operations in a transaction succeed or all fail.

questions.question: Which scenarios are example use cases for Amazon DynamoDB Streams? (Select TWO)
questions.explanation: DynamoDB Streams capture time-ordered sequences of item-level modifications, making them ideal for use cases like sending mobile notifications when data changes or monitoring tables for specific value thresholds.

questions.question: Which statement about global tables is true?
options: Global tables provide a managed solution for replicating tables within a single AWS Region
Global tables use Amazon Simple Storage Service (Amazon S3) to propagate changes between replicas
When a global table is created, Amazon DynamoDB performs all necessary tasks to create identical tables and propagate ongoing data changes to specified Regions
With a global table, Amazon DynamoDB supports partial replication of some of the items in a table
questions.explanation: DynamoDB Global Tables automatically replicate data across multiple AWS regions, handle all the replication tasks, and provide multi-master capabilities with typically under one second replication latency.

questions.question: How far back in days can an Amazon DynamoDB table be restored by using point-in-time recovery?
questions.explanation: DynamoDB Point-in-Time Recovery (PITR) provides continuous backups and allows you to restore your table to any point in time within the last 35 days.

questions.question: Which statement describes Amazon DynamoDB application programming interface (API) control operations that can be invoked by an application?
options: Create, read, update, and delete data in a table
Get and write batches of items in a DynamoDB table
Make coordinated, all-or-nothing changes to multiple items both within and across tables
questions.explanation: Control plane operations manage DynamoDB resources (tables, indexes, streams), while data plane operations handle the actual data (CRUD operations, queries, scans).

questions.question: Which phrase best describes a RESTful API?
options: An API that uses HTTP to communicate between client and server
A proxy that exists between client and server to handle common problems that occur with API-driven applications
An API that follows the principles of the Representational State Transfer style
An API that resides on the web server
questions.explanation: RESTful APIs adhere to REST architectural principles, including statelessness, cacheability, layered system, uniform interface, and code on demand.

questions.question: Which option suggests the use of WebSocket APIs?
options: An order processing application returns an order number to each customer when they submit an order
A batch process bundles orders and sends them to a fulfillment center application
A real-time chat application lets customers talk to customer support about their orders
A reporting application gives the sales team access to static daily reports from their phones
questions.explanation: WebSocket APIs maintain persistent, bidirectional connections between clients and servers, making them ideal for real-time applications like chat, gaming, and live data feeds.

questions.question: Which use case suggests using Amazon API Gateway HTTP APIs?
options: An application needs an API proxy in front of an AWS Lambda function
An application must transform a response from an AWS Lambda function before returning the response to the client
A developer wants to use mock endpoints to test their API
A developer wants to assign different API quotas by client
questions.explanation: HTTP APIs are optimized for serverless workloads and proxy integrations, providing a lightweight, low-cost option for connecting clients to Lambda functions and other HTTP endpoints.

questions.question: Which statement about Amazon API Gateway integrations is true?
options: A first-class integration connects an API Gateway HTTP API route to an external third-party service API
A developer can use HTTP proxy integrations to direct a route to a resource on the internet
API Gateway cannot access resources within a virtual private cloud (VPC)
An API integration request encapsulates an HTTP request that the backend receives and is always different from the method request that the client submits
questions.explanation: HTTP proxy integrations in API Gateway can route requests to any HTTP endpoint, including resources on the internet, making it versatile for various integration scenarios.

questions.question: An application that uses Amazon API Gateway must capture contact information from a third-party client application. The client application sends given name, surname, business phone, and cell phone. The backend application database has only two fields: name and mobile phone. Which option requires the fewest application changes?
options: Export the API definition and use it to update the client
Use a mapping template to transform the request before it is sent to the database
Create a usage plan that describes the fields and applies only to this client
Use a first-class integration to connect the client to the database
questions.explanation: Mapping templates in API Gateway can transform request and response payloads without requiring changes to the backend application or client, making them ideal for data format conversions.

questions.question: Which elements are part of the base URI that AWS generates for an Amazon API Gateway API?
questions.explanation: API Gateway base URIs include the region and stage name (e.g., https://api-id.execute-api.region.amazonaws.com/stage), which helps organize and version API deployments.

questions.question: Given the AWS CLI command to create an API route, which option creates a route that returns an individual product value from an online catalog?
questions.explanation: The route-key 'GET /products/{product_id}' defines a route that handles GET requests for individual products, where {product_id} is a path parameter that can capture specific product identifiers.

questions.question: Which statement about Amazon API Gateway stages is true?
options: Stage names are sequentially assigned based on the API version
Any stage on any API type can be set to autodeploy
Developers can use stage variables to connect different stages to different backends
Developers should avoid creating different stages for each development environment
questions.explanation: Stage variables are name-value pairs that can be used to configure stage-specific settings, such as connecting different stages (dev, test, prod) to different backend endpoints.

questions.question: A security team wants to know how to protect APIs in their internet application from common web exploits, like SQL injection or cross-site scripting. Which solution most directly addresses their specific concern?
options: Set throttling limits on their API methods in Amazon API Gateway
Set all of their APIs to use private endpoints
Configure a JSON Web Token (JWT) based authorizer for Amazon API Gateway
Use AWS WAF with Amazon API Gateway
questions.explanation: AWS WAF (Web Application Firewall) specifically protects against common web exploits like SQL injection, cross-site scripting, and other OWASP Top 10 security risks when integrated with API Gateway.

questions.question: What does the Amazon API Gateway integration Latency metric tell the user?
options: Frequency of server-side errors that affect latency
Speed of the API response back to the client
questions.explanation: Integration Latency measures the time between when API Gateway relays a request to the backend and when it receives the response, indicating the backend's responsiveness independent of network latency.

tests.id: Aws Cloud Bacics and Developing combined
tests.name: AWS Cloud Basics and Developing
tests.description: A combined test on AWS Cloud Basics and Developing on AWS.

questions.question: What are the advantages of cloud computing over computing on-premises?
questions.explanation: All of the above are key advantages of cloud computing. Cloud computing eliminates large upfront capital expenses, allows using capacity as needed, enables global deployment quickly, and increases business agility.

questions.question: What is the pricing model that enables AWS customers to pay for resources on an as needed basis?
questions.explanation: Pay as you go is AWS's fundamental pricing model where customers only pay for the resources they actually use, without long-term commitments or upfront fees.

questions.question: Which of these is NOT a cloud computing model?
questions.explanation: System administration as a service is not a recognized cloud computing model. The main cloud service models are IaaS, PaaS, and SaaS.

questions.question: True or False? AWS owns and maintains the network-connected hardware required for application services, while you provision and use what you need.
questions.explanation: True. This is part of the shared responsibility model - AWS manages the underlying infrastructure and hardware, while customers manage what they provision on top of it.

questions.question: Which of these is NOT a benefit of cloud computing over on-premises computing?
options: Pay for racking, stacking, and powering servers
Eliminate guessing on your infrastructure capacity needs
Trade capital expense for variable expense
Benefit from massive economies of scale
questions.explanation: Paying for racking, stacking, and powering servers is actually a characteristic of on-premises computing, not a benefit of cloud computing. In the cloud, AWS handles all the physical infrastructure management.

questions.question: Which of the following are NOT benefits of AWS Cloud computing? (Choose two)
options: Multiple procurement cycles and High latency
questions.explanation: Multiple procurement cycles and high latency are NOT benefits of AWS cloud computing. AWS eliminates long procurement cycles and provides low-latency access through global infrastructure.

questions.question: Which of the following is a compute service?
questions.explanation: Amazon EC2 (Elastic Compute Cloud) is AWS's primary compute service that provides virtual servers in the cloud.

questions.question: True or False? Cloud computing provides a simple way to access servers, storage, databases, and a broad set of application services over the internet. You own the network-connected hardware required for these services and Amazon Web Services provisions what you need.
questions.explanation: False. In cloud computing, you do NOT own the network-connected hardware. AWS owns and maintains the hardware, and you provision and use what you need as a service.

questions.question: Economies of scale result from
options: having hundreds of thousands of customers aggregated in the cloud
having hundreds of cloud services available over the internet
having to invest heavily in data centers and servers
questions.explanation: Economies of scale result from having hundreds of thousands of customers aggregated in the cloud, which allows AWS to achieve lower per-unit costs and pass those savings to customers.

questions.question: Which of these are ways to access AWS core services? (Choose three)
options: AWS Management Console, AWS CLI, and SDKs
Technical support calls and AWS Marketplace
AWS CLI, SDKs, and Technical support
AWS Marketplace, Management Console, and Support calls
questions.explanation: The three primary ways to access AWS services are through the AWS Management Console (web interface), AWS Command Line Interface (CLI), and Software Development Kits (SDKs) for various programming languages.

questions.question: For certain services like Amazon EC2 and Amazon RDS, you can invest in reserved capacity. What options are available for Reserved Instances? (Choose three)
questions.explanation: The three Reserved Instance payment options are All Upfront (AURI), No Upfront (NURI), and Partial Upfront (PURI), which provide different levels of upfront payment versus hourly rates.

questions.question: Where can a customer go to get more details about Amazon EC2 billing activity that took place 3 months ago?
options: AWS CloudTrail logs stored in Amazon S3
questions.explanation: AWS Cost Explorer provides detailed historical billing data and cost analysis, making it the best tool for reviewing past billing activity from several months ago.

questions.question: True or false? To receive the discounted rate associated with Reserved Instances, you must make a full, upfront payment for the term of the agreement.
questions.explanation: False. While All Upfront Reserved Instances require full payment, there are also Partial Upfront and No Upfront options that provide discounts with different payment structures.

questions.question: Which statement is true about the pricing model on AWS?
options: In most cases, there is a per gigabyte charge for inbound data transfer
Storage is typically charged per gigabyte
Compute is typically charged as a monthly fee based on instance type
Outbound charges are free up to a per account limit
questions.explanation: Storage on AWS is typically charged per gigabyte per month, with different rates for different storage classes and access patterns.

questions.question: What are the four support plans offered by AWS Support?
questions.explanation: AWS offers four support plans: Basic (free), Developer, Business, and Enterprise, each with increasing levels of support and features.

questions.question: Which AWS tool lets you explore AWS services and create an estimate for the cost of your use cases on AWS?
questions.explanation: AWS Pricing Calculator allows you to explore AWS services and configure them to create detailed cost estimates for your specific use cases.

questions.question: As AWS grows, the cost of doing business is reduced and savings are passed back to the customer with lower pricing. What is this optimization called?
questions.explanation: Economies of scale refers to the cost advantages that AWS achieves due to its scale of operations, which are then passed on to customers through lower prices.

questions.question: True or false? AWS offers some services at no charge, such as Amazon VPC, AWS IAM, Consolidated Billing, AWS Elastic Beanstalk, automatic scaling, AWS OpsWorks and AWS CloudFormation. However, you might be charged for other AWS services that you use in conjunction with these services.
questions.explanation: True. While these specific services are offered at no additional charge, you still pay for the underlying resources you provision through them (like EC2 instances, storage, etc.).

questions.question: What are benefits of using AWS Organizations? (Choose two)
options: Group account management and API automation
Unlimited OUs and root user protection
questions.explanation: AWS Organizations provides the ability to create groups of accounts and attach policies to groups, and simplifies automating account creation and management using APIs.

questions.question: True or false? Unlimited services are available with the AWS Free Tier to new AWS customers for 12 months following their AWS sign-up date.
questions.explanation: False. The AWS Free Tier has specific limits on services and usage. It's not unlimited - there are constraints on the amount of resources you can use for free within the first 12 months.

questions.question: Which component of the AWS Global Infrastructure does Amazon CloudFront use to ensure low-latency delivery?
questions.explanation: Amazon CloudFront uses AWS edge locations, which are distributed globally, to cache content closer to users and ensure low-latency content delivery.

questions.question: You can run applications and workloads from a region closer to the end users to _________ latency.
questions.explanation: Decrease. Running applications from regions closer to end users reduces the distance data must travel, thereby decreasing latency and improving performance.

questions.question: True / False? Networking, storage, compute and databases are examples of service categories that AWS offers.
questions.explanation: True. These are fundamental service categories offered by AWS, along with many others like security, analytics, machine learning, and application integration.

questions.question: Which of these statements about Availability Zones is not true?
options: Availability Zones are designed for fault isolation
Availability Zones are made up of one or more data centers
Availability zones are connected to each other using high-speed private links
A data center can be used for more than one availability zone
questions.explanation: A data center cannot be used for more than one Availability Zone. Each Availability Zone is a distinct physical location with one or more data centers, but a single data center doesn't serve multiple AZs.

questions.question: What is true about Regions? (Choose two)
options: They are physical locations with multiple AZs in separate geographic areas
They are the physical locations of your customers
All regions are located in one specific geographic area
A region has multiple AZs and each region is geographically separate
questions.explanation: A region is a physical location that has multiple Availability Zones, and each region is located in a separate geographic area to provide geographic diversity and disaster recovery capabilities.

questions.question: _________ means the infrastructure has built-in component redundancy and _________ means that resources dynamically adjust to increases or decreases in capacity requirements.
questions.explanation: Fault-tolerant means the infrastructure has built-in component redundancy to withstand failures, while elastic and scalable means resources can dynamically adjust to changing capacity requirements.

questions.question: True or False? Availability Zones within a region are connected through low-latency links.
questions.explanation: True. Availability Zones within a region are connected through high-bandwidth, low-latency networking, enabling synchronous replication and fast failover between zones.

questions.question: AWS highly recommends provisioning your compute resources across _________ availability zones.
questions.explanation: Multiple. Distributing resources across multiple Availability Zones provides high availability and fault tolerance, protecting against failures in a single zone.

questions.question: True or False? Edge locations are only located in the same general area as regions.
questions.explanation: False. Edge locations are distributed globally in many more locations than regions, often in major population centers to provide low-latency access to users worldwide.

questions.question: In the shared responsibility model, AWS is responsible for providing what?
questions.explanation: Security of the cloud refers to AWS's responsibility to protect the infrastructure that runs all the services offered in the AWS Cloud.

questions.question: In the shared responsibility model, which of the following are examples of 'Security in the cloud'? (Choose two)
options: Security group configurations and Data encryption
Physical security and Global infrastructure protection
Data encryption and Physical facility security
questions.explanation: Security group configurations and encryption of data at rest and in transit are customer responsibilities under 'Security in the cloud', while AWS handles 'Security of the cloud' including physical security and infrastructure protection.

questions.question: Which AWS networking service enables a company to create a virtual network within AWS?
questions.explanation: Amazon VPC (Virtual Private Cloud) enables you to provision a logically isolated section of the AWS Cloud where you can launch AWS resources in a virtual network that you define.

questions.question: With Amazon VPC, what is the smallest size subnet you can have in a VPC?
questions.explanation: /28 is the smallest subnet size in Amazon VPC, providing 16 IP addresses (11 usable after AWS reserves 5).

questions.question: With Amazon VPC, what is the maximum size IP address range you can have in a VPC?
questions.explanation: /16 is the maximum CIDR block size for a VPC, providing 65,536 IP addresses (65,531 usable after AWS reserves 5).

questions.question: You need to allow resources in a private subnet to access the internet. Which of the following must be present to enable this access?
questions.explanation: A NAT (Network Address Translation) gateway allows instances in a private subnet to connect to the internet or other AWS services, while preventing the internet from initiating connections with those instances.

questions.question: True/False, Private subnets have direct access to the internet.
questions.explanation: False. Private subnets do not have direct internet access. They require a NAT gateway or NAT instance to access the internet, which provides outbound-only internet connectivity.

questions.question: Which of the following is an optional security control that can be applied at the subnet layer of a VPC?
questions.explanation: Network ACLs (Access Control Lists) are optional security controls that operate at the subnet level, providing stateless filtering of traffic entering and leaving subnets.

questions.question: What happens when you use Amazon VPC to create a new VPC?
options: Three subnets are created by default in one Availability Zone
A main route table is created by default
Three subnets are created by default: one for each Availability Zone
An internet gateway is created by default
questions.explanation: When you create a new VPC, AWS automatically creates a main route table for it. Subnets and internet gateways must be created separately.

questions.question: Which of the following can be used to protect Amazon EC2 instances hosted in AWS?
questions.explanation: Security groups act as virtual firewalls for EC2 instances to control inbound and outbound traffic at the instance level.

questions.question: Why is AWS more economical than traditional data centers for applications with varying compute workloads?
options: Amazon EC2 Costs are billed on a monthly basis
Customers retain full administrative access to their Amazon EC2 instances
Customers can permanently run enough instances to handle peak workloads
Amazon EC2 instances can be launched on-demand when needed
questions.explanation: AWS is more economical for variable workloads because you can launch EC2 instances on-demand when needed and terminate them when not needed, avoiding the cost of maintaining idle capacity.

questions.question: If your project requires monthly reports that iterate through very large amounts of data, which Amazon EC2 purchasing option should you consider?
questions.explanation: Scheduled Reserved Instances are ideal for predictable recurring workloads like monthly reports, as they provide capacity reservations that recur on a daily, weekly, or monthly basis.

questions.question: What is included in an Amazon Machine Image (AMI)?
options: A template for the root volume for the instance
Launch permissions that control which AWS accounts can use the AMI to launch instances
A block device mapping that specifies the volumes to attach to the instance when it's launched
questions.explanation: An AMI includes all of these components: template for the root volume, launch permissions, and block device mapping, providing everything needed to launch an instance.

questions.question: Which Amazon EC2 feature ensures your instances will not share a physical host with instances from any other AWS customer?
questions.explanation: Dedicated Instances run on hardware dedicated to a single AWS customer, ensuring no other customers' instances share the same physical host.

questions.question: Which of the following services is a serverless compute service in AWS?
questions.explanation: AWS Lambda is a serverless compute service that runs code in response to events without requiring you to provision or manage servers.

questions.question: What is the service provided by AWS that enables developers to easily deploy and manage applications in the cloud?
questions.explanation: AWS Elastic Beanstalk is an easy-to-use service for deploying and scaling web applications and services without needing to understand the underlying infrastructure.

questions.question: Your web application needs four instances to support steady traffic all of the time. On the last day of the month, the traffic triples. What is the most cost-effective way to handle this pattern?
options: Run 12 reserved instances all of the time
Run four On-demand Instances constantly, then add eight more On-Demand on the last day of each month
