Run four Reserved Instances constantly, then add eight On-Demand Instances on the last day of each month
Run four On-Demand Instances constantly, then add eight Reserved Instances on the last day of each month
questions.explanation: Using Reserved Instances for baseline capacity and On-Demand Instances for predictable spikes is the most cost-effective approach for this usage pattern.

questions.question: True or false? Containers contain an entire operating system.
questions.explanation: False. Containers share the host system's operating system kernel and contain only the application and its dependencies, making them much lighter than virtual machines.

questions.question: Which Amazon EC2 option is best for long-term workload with predictable usage patterns?
questions.explanation: Reserved Instances provide significant cost savings (up to 75% compared to On-Demand) for steady-state, predictable workloads with long-term commitments.

questions.question: True or false. Amazon S3 is an object storage suitable for the storage of flat files like Microsoft Word documents, photos, etc.
questions.explanation: True. Amazon S3 is object storage designed to store and retrieve any amount of data from anywhere, making it ideal for documents, images, videos, and other unstructured data.

questions.question: Amazon S3 replicates all objects _________.
options: On multiple volumes within an availability zone
In multiple Availability zones within the same region
Across multiple regions for higher durability
questions.explanation: Amazon S3 Standard storage automatically replicates data across multiple Availability Zones within the same region to provide 99.999999999% (11 9's) of durability.

questions.question: The name of an S3 bucket must be unique.
questions.explanation: S3 bucket names must be globally unique across all AWS accounts and regions, as they are part of the URL used to access objects in the bucket.

questions.question: You can use Amazon Elastic File System (EFS) to:
options: Provide simple, scalable, elastic file storage for use only within AWS
Implement storage for Amazon EC2 instances that multiple virtual machines can access at the same time
Host a robust CDN to deliver entire web sites with dynamic, static, and streaming content
questions.explanation: Amazon EFS provides scalable, elastic file storage that can be accessed concurrently by multiple EC2 instances across multiple Availability Zones.

questions.question: Amazon Elastic Block Storage (EBS) is recommended when data _________ and _________ (Choose two)
options: Requires object level storage and Must be quickly accessible
Must be quickly accessible and Requires encryption
Requires encryption and Needs cross-AZ storage
Needs cross-AZ storage and Requires object storage
questions.explanation: EBS is ideal for data that must be quickly accessible with low latency and requires persistence, and it supports transparent encryption for data at rest.

questions.question: True or false, by default all data stored in Amazon S3 is viewable by the public.
questions.explanation: False. By default, all S3 buckets and objects are private. Only the bucket and object owners have access until they explicitly grant permissions to others.

questions.question: Regarding Amazon S3 Glacier, what is a vault?
options: The rules that determine who may (or may not) access archives
An object (photos, videos, files, or documents)
A policy that identifies who can access content stored in Glacier
questions.explanation: A vault is a container for storing archives in Amazon S3 Glacier, similar to how a bucket is a container for objects in Amazon S3.

questions.question: True or false. When you create a bucket in Amazon S3, it is associated with a specific AWS region.
questions.explanation: True. When creating an S3 bucket, you must choose the AWS region where the bucket will reside, which determines the physical location where your data is stored.

questions.question: You are designing an ecommerce web application that will scale to hundreds of thousands of concurrent users. Which database technology is best suited to hold the session state in this example?
questions.explanation: Amazon DynamoDB is ideal for session state management due to its fast, predictable performance at any scale, single-digit millisecond latency, and automatic scaling capabilities.

questions.question: You need to find an item in Amazon DynamoDB table using an attribute other than item's primary key. Which operation should you use?
questions.explanation: Scan operations examine every item in the table and return all items that match the filter criteria, but they are less efficient than queries and should be used sparingly on large tables.

questions.question: Which AWS Cloud service is best suited for analyzing your data by using standard SQL and your existing business intelligence (BI) tools?
questions.explanation: Amazon Redshift is a fast, fully managed data warehouse that makes it simple and cost-effective to analyze all your data using standard SQL and existing BI tools.

questions.question: Which of the following use cases is appropriate for using Amazon RDS?
questions.explanation: Amazon RDS is ideal for applications that require complex transactions with ACID properties, such as OLTP workloads, financial systems, and inventory management.

questions.question: If you are developing an application that requires a database with extremely fast performance, fast scalability, and flexibility in the database schema, which service would you consider?
questions.explanation: Amazon DynamoDB provides single-digit millisecond performance at any scale, automatic scaling, and schema flexibility as a NoSQL database service.

questions.question: True of false? Amazon RDS automatically patches the database software and backs up your database, storing the backups for a user-defined retention period and enabling point-in-time recovery
questions.explanation: True. Amazon RDS automates common administrative tasks like backups, software patching, and point-in-time recovery, making database management much simpler.

questions.question: Which of the following is not one of the four areas of the Performance Efficiency pillar of the AWS Well-Architected Framework?
questions.explanation: Traceability is not one of the four areas. The Performance Efficiency pillar focuses on Selection, Review, Monitoring, and Tradeoffs to ensure efficient use of computing resources.

questions.question: Which of the following is a principle when designing cloud-based systems?
options: Use as many services as possible
questions.explanation: Assuming everything will fail is a key design principle for cloud systems, encouraging the design of resilient architectures that can withstand component failures.

questions.question: Which of the following are pillars of the AWS Well-Architected Framework? (Choose three)
options: Security, Operational Excellence, and Cost Optimization
Operational Excellence, Cost Optimization, and Persistence
questions.explanation: The five pillars of the Well-Architected Framework are Operational Excellence, Security, Reliability, Performance Efficiency, and Cost Optimization.

questions.question: AWS Trusted Advisor provides insight regarding which five categories of an AWS account?
options: Performance, cost optimization, security, fault tolerance, service limits
Security, Fault tolerance, high availability, connectivity, service limits
Performance, cost optimization, access control, connectivity, security
Security, access control, high availability, performance, service limits
questions.explanation: AWS Trusted Advisor provides best practice checks and recommendations in five categories: cost optimization, performance, security, fault tolerance, and service limits.

questions.question: What is the focus of the sustainability pillar of the well-architected framework?
options: Designing workloads that recover quickly from failures
Minimize the environmental impacts of the running cloud networks
Avoid unnecessary cost in cloud networks
questions.explanation: The sustainability pillar focuses on minimizing the environmental impacts of cloud workloads by maximizing energy efficiency and reducing resource consumption.

questions.question: Which AWS tools help your application scale up or down based on demand? (Choose two)
options: Amazon EC2 Auto Scaling and Elastic Load Balancing
AWS CloudFormation and Elastic Load Balancing
Availability Zones and Amazon EC2 Auto Scaling
questions.explanation: Amazon EC2 Auto Scaling automatically adds or removes EC2 instances based on demand, while Elastic Load Balancing distributes traffic across multiple targets to handle varying loads.

questions.question: Which service would you use to send alerts based on Amazon CloudWatch alarms?
questions.explanation: Amazon SNS is used to send notifications and alerts based on CloudWatch alarms, supporting multiple delivery protocols including email, SMS, and HTTP/HTTPS endpoints.

questions.question: Which of the following must be configured on an Elastic Load Balancing load balancer to expect incoming traffic?
questions.explanation: A listener is a process that checks for connection requests using the protocol and port you configure, and is required for a load balancer to accept incoming traffic.

questions.question: There is an audit at your company and they need to have a big log of all access to AWS resources in the account. Which service can assist in providing these details?
questions.explanation: AWS CloudTrail enables governance, compliance, and operational and risk auditing of your AWS account by logging API calls and related events.
